instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7050: What is R7050? Current sense shunt resistor for the battery, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 17/18 on ISL6259 should give you 2.02 ohms. .
definitions.R7052: What is R7052? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light fan spins and stops
threads.message:
After connecting the charger I get a green light no orange, the fan starts to spin for a number of seconds and then reboots. PPBUS goes to 12.58 then drops to 4v and shows OL, and then reboots. It cannot run only from battery. Onewire lines are all OK and3.42 is present. CPU Vcore comes on to 1.15 with fan spin. What to check next?

Some measurements

<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> 17/18 = 55.2ohm
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> 27/28 = 21 ohm
ACOK = present on pin 14.
Pin 3 ACIN = 3.9
Pin 2 DCIN = 16.58 - 16.16v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light fan spins and stops
threads.message:
Pin 17 and 18 is your problem should be 3.9 ohms not 55. One of 4 things is true (or multiple)
1. <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> is blown
2. <RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR> is blown
3. <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR> is blown (much less likely but possible)
4. The traces between the ISL and <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/2 are blown and/or the traces between <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/2 are blown.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green light fan spins and stops
threads.message: Tanks John, havent been at it for a week but tomorrow will check these issues.
